Name: VS Code 0.1.14: Configure your settings
Update Summary: In this release, we’re adding options to limit your notifications and choose how to accept auto-complete suggestions. Personalize your experience today!
MainBody:
As we add features to Pieces for VS Code and it becomes a deeper part of your workflow, it’s even more important to us to make it as customizable as possible. In this release, we’re adding options to limit your notifications and choose how to accept auto-complete suggestions, as well as crushing several bugs.

Configure your settings

Choose your notifications

Thank you for all of your feedback on our notifications! We agree that they can get noisy. Now, you can select the amount of notifications you see by choosing between “Critical Notifications” or “All Notifications” in the settings menu.

If you opt for “Critical Notifications,” we’ll only notify you about errors that will prevent you from using Pieces.

Choose your auto-complete selection key

Auto-completing code from your personal micro-repo is one of our favorite features. To make auto-complete even more tuned to you, you can now choose which key you’d like to use to accept auto-complete suggestions:

  1. Enter or Tab : hitting either key will accept the suggestion
  2. Tab: only hitting tab will accept the suggestion

Bug Fixes

This release also crushes a couple of persistent bugs, including an overly noisy auto-complete error notification. Now, it will appear only once.

Support

As always, if you run into issues or have feedback, please fill out this quick form or email us at support@pieces.app and we’ll be in touch as soon as possible!
